channel.title: Human vs Alien?
channel.description: Alright this more on the technological side of the two "races". Anyways, everyone believes that aliens would be more advance then us. Why? What would cause them to know more then us? Why would they not tell us if they already know we exist? So what are your beliefs on alien vs human science and technology? -- Also, in a war, who would win?

All i have to say is “The Twilight Zone: To Serve Man”
[/quote]
I loved that episode.[/quote]

Dude, at the end, i about lost it. It was the biggest twist ever!!

item.title: Human vs Alien?
item.dc:creator: @voiD_dev voiD dev
item.description:
@voiD_dev wrote:

[quote="_Vengeance, post:56, topic:213860"]Imo, of course there is aliens out there. Most likely they are nothing like us - why would they be anything remotely similar?
People often just assume life needs oxygen and water etc… to exist. Just because most life on Earth needs it, doesn’t mean life elsewhere will need it.
Also - IIRC, there is bacteria on our very own earth that doesn’t require water, and lives by absorbing rocks or something along those lines been found in deep caves.[/quote]
Its called parasitism, and they do require water. They only suck out the nutrients in the rock. The rest they absorb through air or another element such as actually being in the water itself.

Read full topic

Also - IIRC, there is bacteria on our very own earth that doesn’t require water, and lives by absorbing rocks or something along those lines been found in deep caves.

item.title: Human vs Alien?
item.dc:creator: @billygotshot billygotshot
item.description:
@billygotshot wrote:

[quote=“IP-Drowner, post:49, topic:213860”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=281434.msg2308644#msg2308644 date=1214953811]

Maybe the meteor entered the Earth’s atomosphere and some bacteria got hit by it.

Once in the atmosphere it can’t get out again.
[/quote]
Not really. It’s pretty much based on the gravitational pull towards the core.[/quote]

Because gravity just magically reversed to let the meteor out of the atmosphere…

[quote=“wow_raped XD, post:50, topic:213860”]WE GOT NUKES!!!#$!
do they?

Depends if they have better technology then us, If we find them, like eating raw meat of animal on their planet, obvisouly, we would win.
If they find us, and can blow us up with a single bomb, then we lose.[/quote]

What I don’t understand is why everyone thinks of an alien surviving the same way we do. For all we know they can live on a planet with no atmosphere and they eat dirt. There is no reason to say they eat and drink the same way as we do. Anyways, I guess what everyone is saying is that if we find them then we will win and if they find us we will lose. I wonder what would happen if we met in space.

Read full topic

item.title: Human vs Alien?
item.dc:creator: @billygotshot billygotshot
item.description:
@billygotshot wrote:

[quote=“pk4pk, post:40, topic:213860”][quote author=billygotshot link=topic=281434.msg2304433#msg2304433 date=1214775817]

We found water on mars, whose to say no life.

Who is to say life needs water to survive.
[/quote]
Well on earth pretty much every organism needs water to survive. And usually wheres theres water theres life.[/quote]

So on another planet maybe the dirt is essential for life not water. Maybe the gas in the air is essential. There is nothing that states that you need water to survive. At least you have now clue if an alien species needs it.

Read full topic

item.title: Human vs Alien?

We found water on mars, whose to say no life.

Who is to say life needs water to survive.
[/quote]
Well on earth pretty much every organism needs water to survive. And usually wheres theres water theres life.[/quote]
That’s earth life, though. Life could be very different on other planets.
